grammarModel.structure

Interface ISyntacticStructure

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAbstractPosition, IEndPosition, IRule, ISpecifiedProminentPosition, ISyntacticBranch, ISyntacticLeaf, ISyntacticTree, IValueOrRelation
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CentralPosition, EndPosition, EndPositionLeaf, Enumeration, EnumerationLeaf, FirstPosition, FirstValue, FirstValueLeaf, Increment, IncrementLeaf, LastPosition, Letter, LetterLeaf, LetterValue, LetterValueLeaf, Position, PositionLeaf, ProminentPosition, ProminentPositionLeaf, Relation, RelationLeaf, Sequence, SequenceLeaf, Size, SizeLeaf, SyntacticBranch, SyntacticLeaf, SyntacticStructure, SyntacticTree, ValueLeaf

    public interface ISyntacticStructure
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    ISyntacticStructure is an abstract class that can be extended in order to represent : 1/ a syntactic tree terminal node (or 'syntactic leaf') 2/ the derivation from a non-terminal node ('syntactic branch') 3/ a whole syntactic tree (which is also a 'syntactic branch', but not contained in any other syntactic branch) 4/ a list of syntactic trees (called a 'syntactic glove').
    Author:
    Gael Tregouet

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name (or type) of the node from which the syntactic structure is derivated. This name refers to a grammatical element of the context-free grammar at use. Two different syntactic structures can have the same name if this name is a non-terminal element (or 'variable') of a context-free grammar (for it can lead to different derivations).

      • getSyntacticChains

        ISyntacticChains getSyntacticChains()
                             throws GrammarModelException
        Returns:
        the set of spanning chains that can be extracted from this structure. All those chains start with the structure name (which designate its generating node) and end with a terminal element of the context-free grammar.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException

      • getSetOfSyntacticChains

        java.util.Set<ISyntacticChains> getSetOfSyntacticChains()
                                                 throws GrammarModelException
        Recursive method.
        Returns:
        the set of spanning chains that can be extracted from this structure, as well as the sets of chains extracted from all this structure components, sub-components. etc.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException

      • getPosetMaxChains

        IPosetMaxChains getPosetMaxChains()
                           throws GrammarModelException
        Returns:
        the set of spanning chains of the lower semilattice associated with this syntactic structure. These chains are used as a parameter for the property poset constructor.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException
        See Also:
        IOriginalPropertyPoset

      • getImplications

        java.util.Set<IImplication> getImplications()
                                     throws GrammarModelException
        Returns:
        the set of implications derived from the lower semilattice associated with this syntactic structure. These implications can be used as a parameter for the property poset constructor.
        Throws:
        GrammarModelException
